ygData.subject: Re: Heritrix 2.0.0 Job start
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Noah, Thanks for the prompt reply the other day. Apologies for the tardiness on my part I am using 1.14.3 now. I still cant get cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar

Hi Noah,

Thanks for the prompt reply the other day. Apologies for the tard=
iness on my part

I am using 1.14.3 now.

I still cant get cmdline-jmxclien=
t-0.10.5.jar to work :-(

These are the steps I follow.

1. unpack the Heri=
trix tgz (NOT building from source, sos nothing much tobe done there)

2. r=
un the following command from /bin directory

./heritrix  -b / -a admin:jaz=
zjazz

I get this message

Wed Mar 25 19:03:57 EST 2009 Starting heritrix
H=
eritrix 1.14.3 is running.
Web console is at: http://0.0.0.0:8080
Web conso=
le login and password: admin/jazzjazz

3. Now I try and type this in 
java =
-jar cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar controlRole:admin localhost:8080 org.arch=
ive.crawler:name=3DHeritrix,type=3DService

After abt 15 secs I get  ..
___=

Over all, All I want to do is to be able to connect to Heritrix =
from another machine on the same network (therefore the 
"-b /" when starti=
ng Heritrex), and control jobs from there (Start jobs, pause jobs, stop job=
s and delete jobs and look at reports.) 

I was using Heritrix 2.0.0 so I c=
ould create folders in the Heritrix directory and then kick off the crawl v=
ia the web interface. This is getting tedious to be honest and seems like a=
 hack.

Is there a Perl module which I can use to connect to Heritrix and c=
ontrol it?

Thanks for the help so far, Appreciate it

Cheers

--- In archi=
ve-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Noah Levitt <nlevitt@...> wrote:
>
> Hello enig=
macodes,
> 
> FYI the current policy is to recommend starting with heritrix=
 1.14.3, until 2.2 comes out.
> 
> enigmacodes wrote:
> > Hi all,
> > 
> > =
I am new to heritrix. I wanted to run the crawler from the command-line.
> =
> what are the options for running cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar?
> > I have=
 had a look at http://crawler.archive.org/cmdline-jmxclient/
> > 
> > java =
-jar cmdline-jmxclient.jar USER:PASS HOST:PORT [BEAN] [COMMAND]
> > 
> > Wh=
ere can I find a list of [BEAN]'s available and the related command?
> > I =
am using heritrix-2.0.0-dist.tar.gz.
> 
> There's some rudimentary info on =
using cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar here:
> http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/gro=
up/archive-crawler/message/4994
> 
> > 
> > I get the following error as I =
try to shutdown heritrix from the cmdline:
> > ----------------------------=
--------------------------------------------------------
> > root@pk:/usr/l=
ocal/Heritrix/heritrix-2.0.0/bin# java -jar cmdline-jmxclient-0.10.5.jar co=
ntrolRole:admin localhost:8080 org.archive.crawler:jmxport=3D8849,name=3DHe=
ritrix,type=3DCrawlService,guiport=3D8080,host=3Dpk shutdown
> > Exception =
in thread "main" java.io.IOException: Failed to retrieve RMIServer stub: ja=
vax.naming.CommunicationException [Root exception is java.rmi.ConnectIOExce=
ption: non-JRMP server at remote endpoint]
> 
> You have specified port 808=
0, which is the web ui port. The jmx port is 8849 by default.
> 
> HTH,
> N=
oah
>
